revised_title: John Christopher Willis: A Pioneering Botanist and Evolutionary Theorist
tldr: John Christopher Willis was a renowned botanist and evolutionary theorist who made significant contributions to the understanding of plant taxonomy, distribution, and evolution. He is best known for his work on the Podostemaceae family of plants and his development of the "age and area" hypothesis, which proposed that the range of a species is determined by its age. Willis also challenged the theory of natural selection and proposed alternative mechanisms for evolution, such as large-scale mutations and the divergence theory.
